revised_title: The Discovery Committee's Contributions to Oceanography and Whale Research
tldr: The Discovery Committee, established in 1924, conducted extensive research in the Southern Ocean, focusing on the biology of whales and their oceanic environment. Their work led to the development of new methods for studying marine life and contributed to the understanding of the region's hydrography and natural history. The committee's efforts were crucial in shaping modern fisheries research and expanding knowledge of the Southern Ocean.
